title: Windows 10 alt-tabbed me during a Ranked game to notify me of an update...
body:
so I did, and now I'm getting FPS drops at medium settings that I didn't have before. I already checked to see if my graphics drivers were up-to-date. 

Any help?

replies.body:
Change your active hours and restart options to stop the windows update notices.

For the FPS issue there is a Riot guide on it but I dont have the link handy, im sure you can google it.
Or just disable the windows update service, and re-enable it when you actually want/need to update

> [{quoted}](name=TimX24968B,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=r9jOi7Eh,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-07-19T17:19:36.907+0000)
>
> Or just disable the windows update service, and re-enable it when you actually want/need to update

Based on how often people post here about getting "hacked" or having all kinds of weird problems i wouldnt recommend that. But if you decide to go that route, you also need to disable the "Background Intelligent Transfer Service"
this is why I say that you need to turn it back on when the time comes to actually update.  recent attacks have only been because people's machines were months outdated.

I definitely agree with Viper that changing maintenance and update schedules can help alleviate sudden interruptions like that.  The frame drops are an interesting case, though, but it could be caused by bad drivers or game files after the update.  Run through each step of the [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide for your specific issue, which should help tune up your pc and settings.  Test it in a custom and let me know if it helps!
